text: what you're seeing in rocket Labs where we're not just playing the near-term craziness we're actually playing slightly longer term ideas here that's where most of the money is so from an options perspective that tells me again that the market is trying to play the long-term move or at least a longer term move SL window as compared to this High concentration in the front expirations so GameStop to me in general looks to be consolidating the areas that I'm really interested in let me get rid of Apple boring Apple the areas I'm interested in realis istically are if we start to see a break above here and it would need to be joined by volume or a break below here this to me would indicate some sort of change to the downside I'm going to get rid of this line just to make it a little cleaner so you can see the range that I'm eyeballing here and I want to see breaks above or breaks below and when I say want to see it's just because it helps me identify which way we're going right because right now it's very much uh who knows right we're just chopping sideways this is standard consolidation but one thing I don't love is that this relative High here is lower than this I would love to see that higher and I also don't love that this low is slightly lower than this relative low so that's typically a bit

text: just chopping sideways this is standard consolidation but one thing I don't love is that this relative High here is lower than this I would love to see that higher and I also don't love that this low is slightly lower than this relative low so that's typically a bit of a curve turning over so we'll see how it goes sideways action for now all right last one is AMC and this will was um I'm not going to AMC is interesting to me to be clear all meme stocks are interesting to me but I don't I haven't like gotten into the story for AMC like I have GameStop so I'm not going to pretend I know anything about AMC or GameStop for that matter but definitely even less AMC so I'm just going to look at this purely from a a a trading lens I don't want you guys to think that there's a lot of baked in ideas here so there really isn't I don't have a lot of context here for AMC but the main thing I do see with AMC is it's essentially falling below this point of control so the point of control clearly was established during this time frame when it was running sideways pretty hard and then it since started rotating down a little bit so it's kind of exhibiting similar Behavior as some of the other meme stocks right so to me it looks like near-term floor looks like something

text: clearly was established during this time frame when it was running sideways pretty hard and then it since started rotating down a little bit so it's kind of exhibiting similar Behavior as some of the other meme stocks right so to me it looks like near-term floor looks like something like this and this would be a close below that somewhere around there and then really once we start breaking above this point of control is where it starts get interesting to me to the upside notice how I use a close for below simply because it what I'm seeing as these candles are getting down towards these swings they extend a little bit but then they suck back up in or they don't extend at all and they just hammer out so there's not like these really big Body candles that are crossing below this threshold and shooting back up above so that's why I would want to see a for something a little more definitive and then for the above side a breakout to a breakout so these things can start moving really really fast so that's why this is a Mark Price alert this is why this is a close price alert slight difference in what I look for the other thing I see here is volume is also siphoned out massively so 10 mil 27 12 12 9 7 99 8 5 almost 6 9 so from here it's contracted a lot here it actually expanded

text: is a close price alert slight difference in what I look for the other thing I see here is volume is also siphoned out massively so 10 mil 27 12 12 9 7 99 8 5 almost 6 9 so from here it's contracted a lot here it actually expanded not not insignificantly again I'm going to zoom this in a little bit further so we can get rid of that Madness yeah so we can open this up a little bit and see on a relative basis a lot of sale volume see all this red lot of sale volume and so yeah it looks like we had a little bit of a a peakiness and volume established here which obviously kicked these averages up a little bit but now um the longer term moving average I think we're right below that here yeah it's 9.4 for a 20-day so a little bit more volume activity from what I can see today compared to the last few days but still not anything like what we were seeing in here around earnings or even before earnings so this to me on a short-term time frame does look way more like a a downtrend right so if on a three-month chart linear these are standard deviation channels negative sloping I'm seeing continuation of lower highs so a high here a lower high here a lower high here a lower high here a lower high here that's a very standard downside continuation
